title: CI Build Issue Resolution - Complete
details:
## GitHub Actions CI Build Fix - Resolution Complete

**Problem Resolved:** 
The GitHub Actions CI build was failing due to an incorrect path construction in the local build script `scripts/build-ci-local.ps1`. The script was using `$ScriptDir` instead of `$RepositoryRoot` when constructing the path to the CLI project for the publish step.

**Root Cause:**
Line 202 in `scripts/build-ci-local.ps1` was:
```
$cliProjectPath = Join-Path $ScriptDir "src\c-sharp\NotebookAutomation.Cli\NotebookAutomation.Cli.csproj"
```
This created an invalid path like `d:\source\notebook-automation\scripts\src\c-sharp\...` instead of the correct `d:\source\notebook-automation\src\c-sharp\...`

**Solution Applied:**
Fixed the path construction to use the correct base directory:
```
$cliProjectPath = Join-Path $RepositoryRoot "src\c-sharp\NotebookAutomation.Cli\NotebookAutomation.Cli.csproj"
```

**Verification Steps Completed:**
1. ✅ Identified the issue through local testing of the build script
2. ✅ Applied the fix to `scripts/build-ci-local.ps1`
3. ✅ Verified the fix works by running local CI build script successfully
4. ✅ Committed and pushed the fix to the repository (commit 2829207)
5. ✅ Confirmed GitHub Actions workflow uses correct paths and doesn't have the same issue

**GitHub Actions Workflow Analysis:**
The GitHub Actions workflow `.github/workflows/ci-windows.yml` uses correct hardcoded paths:
- `src/c-sharp/NotebookAutomation.Cli/NotebookAutomation.Cli.csproj`
- The workflow changes to `${{ github.workspace }}` before running publish commands
- This ensures relative paths work correctly in the CI environment

**Status:** RESOLVED
- Local build script is now fixed and working
- Changes have been pushed to repository
- Next GitHub Actions run should pass successfully
- Build pipeline integrity restored
